node.title: Omicron's 1pm overhaul? Top expert suggests new way of tackling case numbers
node.description: New Covid infections yesterday plunged from Saturday's record tally but one epidemiologist believes the daily case numbers may not reflect the true extent of community spread.

node.title: State of emergency declared over Canadian truck blockade
node.description: Ottawa Mayor Jim Watson has declared a state of emergency to help deal with an unprecedented 10-day occupation by protesting truckers that has shut down much of the core of the Canadian capital.

node.title: Australian PM signals reopening borders to tourists 'not far away'
node.description: Scott Morrison says parliament will debate the matter this week.

node.title: Russian attack on Ukraine possible 'any day now', White House says
node.description: The US says Russia has prepared '70 per cent' of military might to launch an attack on Ukraine, but that a peaceful solution to the tensions is not out of the question.

node.title: 'Changing climate': Homes lost as hundreds of firefighters battle spate of destructive blazes in Western Australia
node.description: Authorities say changing climate conditions are a factor in the increased intensity of fires as crews battle dangerous and destructive blazes.

node.title: Three people with serious injuries after Rotorua assaults
node.description: A number of people in Rotorua were assaulted in the early hours of Sunday morning, police say.

node.title: 18 people rescued from ice floe in Lake Erie
node.description: The Coast Guard rescued 11 people, while a "Good Samaritan" who had an airboat rescued the remaining seven, the Coast Guard said.

node.title: Indian singing legend Lata Mangeshkar dies at 92
node.description: The celebrated singer had been admitted to hospital after testing positive for Covid-19.

node.title: Recycling startup growing, despite tornado and pandemic
node.description: A plastic recycling business brought to its knees by a tornado is back on its feet, promising to transform the industry - if it can find the right investors.

node.title: MIQ hotels will struggle with border reopening rules - expert
node.description: A hotel industry expert says outgoing managed isolation and quarantine hotels will struggle as short-term visitors could be put off by isolation rules.

node.title: Two arrested after aggravated robbery at Christchurch shop
node.description: Police have arrested two men after an aggravated robbery at a Christchurch shop last month.

node.title: These might be the best quotes about motivation you’ll hear in these Olympics.
node.description: Nils van der Poel said he had tried to quit speedskating twice. But he found inspiration, trained hard and set an Olympic record.

node.title: Concern for tourism as third of bus and coach businesses closed during pandemic
node.description: The Bus and Coach Association is concerned there won't be enough operators to transport tourists around when borders start to open.

node.title: Southland Charity Hospital could open mid-2022 despite setbacks
node.description: The pandemic has caused setbacks for the new Southland Charity Hospital, but it's already offering colonoscopies and could open by mid-2022.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on February 6, 2022
node.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Senator Marco Rubio and former national security adviser H.R. McMaster join Margaret Brennan.

node.title: Retail group Briscoes forecasts record full year earnings and profit
node.description: The company, which has the Briscoes Homeware, Rebel Sport, and Living and Giving chains, is forecasting a full year profit of around $87 million, nearly 20 percent higher than last year's $73.2m.

node.title: Cyclists allowed to use stretch of Transmission Gully despite 'no cycling' sign
node.description: Cyclists thought they had been banned from using a key stretch due to a 'no cycling' sign, but Waka Kotahi has now clarified they can use it - and the sign should have been covered.

node.title: $36m Court Theatre project in Christchurch to start in March
node.description: One of Christchurch's major anchor projects post-quake is on track to open in 2024.

node.title: Covid-19 cases fall in NSW and Victoria, but death toll mounting
node.description: Case numbers are falling in Australia's NSW and Victoria, but both states are still grappling with deaths and relying heavily on rapid antigen tests.

node.title: From bakers to hotelkeepers: Women made their mark on NZ goldfields
node.description: Women's involvement in many different aspects of the nation's goldfields has been underplayed, even for those who became successful businesswomen, especially as hotel owners, a researcher says. Audio

node.title: Covid-19 update: Number of new community cases drops to 208
node.description: The number of Covid-19 cases in the community has dropped from yesterday's record high, with 208 new cases reported today.

node.title: Transcript: Dr. Scott Gottlieb on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Dr. Scott Gottlieb that aired Sunday, February 6, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Fears of flooding ease for Feilding residents
node.description: There is a reprieve for the Manawatū town of Feilding.

node.title: Infometrics expects Omicron to be among negatives to hit GDP
node.description: The strong economic tailwinds that have supported the country throughout the pandemic appear to be fading, as the country grapples with rising inflation and a constrained labour market.

node.title: McMaster "absolutely" agrees with Pence that he couldn't overturn election
node.description: Pence said last week that former President Donald Trump is "wrong" that he had the authority to overturn the results of the 2020 election.

node.title: Transcript: H.R. McMaster on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with former national security adviser and retired General H.R. McMaster that aired Sunday, February 6, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Snowboarding champion Shaun White to retire
node.description: The face of snowboarding, Shaun White, will retire after Beijing Winter Olympics.

node.title: Transcript: Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Deputy Treasury Secretary Wally Adeyemo that aired Sunday, February 6, 2022, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Get the Children Out of ISIS Detention Camps
node.description: The conditions are horrific and dangerous. And they’re breeding grounds for radicalization and the next generation of ISIS adherents.

node.title: My Trans Journey: A History in 6 Passports
node.description: A trans woman’s passport photos show more than the countries she has visited.
